speaker: menteith
dialog: The English power is near, led on by Malcolm, His uncle Siward and the good Macduff: Revenges burn in them; for their dear causes Would to the bleeding and the grim alarm. Excite the mortified man.

speaker: angus
dialog: Near Birnam wood. Shall we well meet them; that way are they coming.

speaker: caithness
dialog: Who knows if Donalbain be with his brother?

speaker: lennox
dialog: For certain, sir, he is not: I have a file. Of all the gentry: there is Siward's son. And many unrough youths that even now protest their first of manhood.

speaker: caithness
dialog: Great Dunsinane he strongly fortifies: Some say he's mad; others that lesser hate him do call it valiant fury: but, for certain, he cannot buckle his distemper'd cause within the belt of rule.

speaker: angus
dialog: Now does he feel his secret murders sticking on his hands; now minutely revolts upbraid his faith-breach; those he commands move only in command, nothing in love: now does he feel his title hang loose about him, like a giant's robe upon a dwarfish thief.

speaker: menteith
dialog: Who then shall blame his pester'd senses to recoil and start, when all that is within him does condemn itself for being there?

speaker: caithness
dialog: Well, march we on, to give obedience where 'tis truly owed: Meet we the medicine of the sickly weal, and with him pour we in our country's purge each drop of us.

speaker: lennox
dialog: Or so much as it needs, to dew the sovereign flower and drown the weeds. Make we our march towards Birnam.
